title: sftp artifact logging to remote server : Permission denied
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Ubuntu 18.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pip
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.4.0
- **Python version**: 3.7

### Describe the problem
I setup a remote MLFlow tracking server along with a SFTP server. The server is running well, it logs metadata, and I can access the SFTP server remotely with a SSH key.

The SFTP server allows the users of the remote server to access it.

On my local machine I run the simple example file found in the doc to log some metrics and artifact, but I encountered a `Permission Denied` error as mlflow tries to save the artifacts in a local path (that does not exist) instead of using the remote SFTP server.

### Code to reproduce issue
**Launching tracking remote server**
mlflow server --backend-store-uri postgresql://mlflow:mlflow@localhost/mlflow --default-artifact-root sftp://<remote_server_user>@localhost:/home/<remote_server_user>/mlflow/mlruns -h 0.0.0.0 -p 8000

**local python code**
I added the following environment variable 
```export MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI="http://<remote_server_ip>:8000```

I also tried to add the following environment variable but it does not change anything
```export MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI='sftp://<remote_server_user>@<remote_server_ip>:20'```


```
import os
import mlflow
from mlflow import log_metric, log_param, log_artifact, set_experiment, start_run

if __name__ == "__main__":
    set_experiment("test")
    with start_run():
        # Log a parameter (key-value pair)
        log_param("param1", 5)

        # Log a metric; metrics can be updated throughout the run
        log_metric("foo", 1)
        log_metric("foo", 2)
        log_metric("foo", 3)

        # Log an artifact (output file)
        with open("output.txt", "w") as f:
            f.write("Hello world!")
        print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri())
        log_artifact("output.txt")
```

### Other info / logs
**The artifact uri used:**
```
file:/home/<remote_server_user>/mlflow/mlruns/1/d478434e4f1a4370a0bf577615c869d7/artifacts
```

**Error trace**
```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "tracking.py", line 20, in <module>
    log_artifact("output.txt")
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/fluent.py", line 292, in log_artifact
    MlflowClient().log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/client.py", line 251, in log_artifact
    self._tracking_client.log_artifact(run_id, local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/tracking/_tracking_service/client.py", line 247, in log_artifact
    artifact_repo.log_artifact(local_path, artifact_path)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/store/artifact/local_artifact_repo.py", line 31, in log_artifact
    mkdir(artifact_dir)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 106, in mkdir
    raise e
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/site-packages/mlflow/utils/file_utils.py", line 103, in mkdir
    os.makedirs(target)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 211, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 211, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 211, in makedirs
    makedirs(head, exist_ok=exist_ok)
  [Previous line repeated 2 more times]
  File "/home/<local_username>/miniconda3/envs/mlflow_env/lib/python3.7/os.py", line 221, in makedirs
    mkdir(name, mode)
PermissionError: [Errno 13] Permission denied: '/home/<remote_server_user>'
```

Obviously, the artifact URI is set to a local file path, the SFTP server URI is not used and I can't figure out how to set it....
